camel.sink.endpoint.defaultFrom.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultFrom
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultFrom.description: This is the sender name. The maximum length is 11 characters.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultMaxNumberOfPa.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultMaxNumberOfParts
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultMaxNumberOfPa.description: If it is a multipart message forces the max number. Message can be truncated. Technically the gateway will first check if a message is larger than 160 characters, if so, the message will be cut into multiple 153 characters parts limited by these parameters.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.testConnectionOnStar.name: camel.sink.endpoint.testConnectionOnStartup
camel.sink.endpoint.testConnectionOnStar.description: Whether to test the connection to the SMS Gateway on startup

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.cm-sms.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.cm-sms.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.cm-sms.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.cm-sms.basicPropertyBind.name: camel.component.cm-sms.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.cm-sms.basicPropertyBind.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
